intro: Dichapetalum brenesii, commonly known as the Bornean star-flower, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Borneo. It is a member of the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
